verse.arabic: لِمَن شَاءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
verse.transliteration: Liman shaa minkum an yataqaddama aw yataakhkhara

root.meaning: belonging to, pertaining to; abstract noun formation
to intend, to will, to desire; to be something
to originate from, to belong to
to be, to exist; to become

components.meaning: particle of subordination, used to introduce a verbal noun or nominal sentence
often functions as a marker for infinitives or verbal nouns, though its standalone meaning is less significant in this context

root.meaning: to advance, to proceed forward, to set forth

components.meaning: indicates imperfect tense, 3rd person masculine singular
to advance, to proceed (verbal noun/root form)
fatha, vowel ending indicating nominative case/imperfect tense

root.meaning: to be late, to lag behind, to postpone; the last part of something

components.meaning: prefix indicating present/future tense and third-person singular masculine
indicates reflexivity; he does it to himself/for himself, or is affected by the action
past tense stem from the root أ-خ-ر, signifying delay or being late

literalTranslation.wordAligned: to-whoever wills from-among you that he-proceeds or he-stays-behind

metadata.scope: no tafsīr, thematic, or theological interpretation
